org.prop4j

Class NodeWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.prop4j.NodeWriter

  • public class NodeWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts a propositional node to a String object.
    Author:
    Thomas Thuem, Timo Günther

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Field Detail

      • noSymbol

        public static final java.lang.String noSymbol
        Denotes an unsupported symbol.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • logicalSymbols

        public static final java.lang.String[] logicalSymbols
        Symbols for a logical representation. These are best used for displaying to the user due to brevity and beauty. Since they consist of unwieldy Unicode characters, do not use them for editing or serialization; in these cases, instead use long or short textual symbols respectively.

      • textualSymbols

        public static final java.lang.String[] textualSymbols
        Symbols for a long textual representation. These are best used for editing by the user due to simplicity and ease of handling. Use logical symbols for displaying to the user and short textual symbols for serialization.

      • shortSymbols

        public static final java.lang.String[] shortSymbols
        Symbols for a short textual representation. Best used for serialization since they fall in the ASCII range but are still relatively short. Use logicalSymbols for displaying to the user and long textual symbols for editing by the user.

      • javaSymbols

        public static final java.lang.String[] javaSymbols
        Symbols for a representation like in Java. These are inherently incomplete and should only be used if absolutely necessary.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeWriter

        public NodeWriter(Node root)
        Constructs a new instance of this class with the given node to transform. By default, the set of short symbols and infix notation are used, brackets are only placed if necessary, and variables containing whitespace will not be enquoted.
        Parameters:
        root - node to transform; not null

    • Method Detail

      • setSymbols

        public void setSymbols(java.lang.String[] symbols)
        Sets the symbols to use for the operations. By index, these are:
        1. Not
        2. And
        3. Or
        4. Implies
        5. Equals
        6. the separator joining the operands of the following operations
        7. Choose
        8. AtLeast
        9. AtMost
        By default, the set of short symbols is used.
        Parameters:
        symbols - symbols for the operations; not null
        See Also:
        logicalSymbols, textualSymbols, shortSymbols, javaSymbols

      • setNotation

        public void setNotation(NodeWriter.Notation notation)
        Sets the notation to use. By default, this is the infix notation.
        Parameters:
        notation - notation to use

      • setEnforceBrackets

        public void setEnforceBrackets(boolean enforceBrackets)
        Sets the enforcing brackets flag. If true, this writer will always place brackets, even if they are semantically irrelevant.
        Parameters:
        enforceBrackets -

      • setEnquoteWhitespace

        public void setEnquoteWhitespace(boolean enquoteWhitespace)
        Sets the enquoting whitespace flag. If true, this writer will enquote variables if they contain whitespace.
        Parameters:
        enquoteWhitespace -

      • nodeToString

        public java.lang.String nodeToString()
        Converts the given node into the specified textual representation.
        Returns:
        the textual representation; not null
